TITLE: Defining Typer SubCommands Structure
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create and organize Typer apps with subcommands for users and items management. The code creates a hierarchical CLI structure with nested commands for operations like create, delete, and sell.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/subcommands/single-file.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()
users_app = typer.Typer()
items_app = typer.Typer()
app.add_typer(users_app, name="users")
app.add_typer(items_app, name="items")

@users_app.command(name="create")
def users_create(username: str):
    typer.echo(f"Creating user: {username}")

@users_app.command(name="delete")
def users_delete(username: str):
    typer.echo(f"Deleting user: {username}")

@items_app.command(name="create")
def items_create(item: str):
    typer.echo(f"Creating item: {item}")

@items_app.command(name="delete")
def items_delete(item: str):
    typer.echo(f"Deleting item: {item}")

@items_app.command(name="sell")
def items_sell(item: str):
    typer.echo(f"Selling item: {item}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Advanced Typer Implementation with Subcommands
DESCRIPTION: Extended Typer example showing multiple subcommands, optional parameters, and command decorators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def hello(name: str):
    print(f"Hello {name}")


@app.command()
def goodbye(name: str, formal: bool = False):
    if formal:
        print(f"Goodbye Ms. {name}. Have a good day.")
    else:
        print(f"Bye {name}!")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Configuring Help Panels for CLI Parameters in Typer
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to organize both CLI arguments and options into custom panels using the 'rich_help_panel' parameter. Arguments are grouped into 'Arguments' and 'Secondary Arguments', while options are grouped into 'Options' and 'Additional Data'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/commands/help.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer
from typing import Optional

app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def create(
    username: str = typer.Argument(
        ...,
        help="The username to create",
    ),
    lastname: Optional[str] = typer.Argument(
        None,
        help="The last name of the new user",
        rich_help_panel="Secondary Arguments",
        show_default=False,
    ),
    force: bool = typer.Option(
        False,
        help="Force the creation of the user",
    ),
    age: Optional[int] = typer.Option(
        None,
        help="The age of the new user",
        rich_help_panel="Additional Data",
    ),
    favorite_color: Optional[str] = typer.Option(
        None,
        help="The favorite color of the new user",
        rich_help_panel="Additional Data",
    ),
):
    """Create a new user. âœ¨"""
    typer.echo(f"Creating user: {username}")


@app.command(rich_help_panel="Utils and Configs")
def config(config_file: str):
    """Configure the system. ðŸ”§"""
    typer.echo(f"Configuring with: {config_file}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Combining Multiple Typer Apps as Subcommands in a Main CLI Application
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import separate Typer applications and combine them as subcommands in a main application. The app.add_typer() method is used to add each app with a specific command name that will group its subcommands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/subcommands/add-typer.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer
import users
import items

app = typer.Typer()
app.add_typer(users.app, name="users")
app.add_typer(items.app, name="items")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

```
app = typer.Typer()

@app.command()
def goodbye(name: str, formal: bool = False):
    if formal:
        print(f"Goodbye Ms. {name}. Have a good day.")
    else:
        print(f"Bye {name}!")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Testing Typer Application with CliRunner
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to test a Typer application using pytest and CliRunner, including assertions for exit code and output text.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/testing.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from typer.testing import CliRunner
from .main import app

runner = CliRunner()

def test_app():
    result = runner.invoke(app, ["Camila", "--city", "Berlin"])
    assert result.exit_code == 0
    assert "Hello Camila" in result.stdout
    assert "Let's have a coffee in Berlin" in result.stdout
```

TITLE: Path Parameter with Validations in Typer CLI Application
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use Path parameter validations in Typer, such as requiring a file to exist, specifying if it should be a file (not a directory), and ensuring it's readable. These validations are performed before the function is called.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/parameter-types/path.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pathlib import Path

import typer


app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def main(
    config: Path = typer.Option(
        ...,
        exists=True,
        file_okay=True,
        dir_okay=False,
        readable=True,
        resolve_path=True,
    ),
):
    text = config.read_text()
    typer.echo(f"Config file contents: {text}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Implementing Commands with Different CLI Options using Typer in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to create a command-line interface with Typer that has multiple commands with different parameters. It shows how to implement required arguments, optional flags, and user confirmation prompts. The example includes commands for creating users, deleting users (with confirmation), deleting all users (with optional force flag), and initializing a database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/commands/options.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer
from typing import Optional

app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def create(username: str):
    typer.echo(f"Creating user: {username}")


@app.command()
def delete(
    username: str,
    force: bool = typer.Option(
        ...,
        prompt="Are you sure you want to delete the user?",
        help="Force deletion without confirmation.",
    ),
):
    if force:
        typer.echo(f"Deleting user: {username}")
    else:
        typer.echo("Operation cancelled")


@app.command()
def delete_all(
    force: bool = typer.Option(
        ...,
        prompt="Are you sure you want to delete ALL users?",
        help="Force deletion without confirmation.",
    ),
):
    if force:
        typer.echo("Deleting all users")
    else:
        typer.echo("Operation cancelled")


@app.command()
def init():
    typer.echo("Initializing user database")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Creating a Simple Typer CLI Application in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code implements a basic portal gun CLI application with Typer. It defines two commands ('shoot' and 'load') along with their documentation and functionality. The app structure follows the Typer pattern with a main app instance and decorated command functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/package.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
import typer


app = typer.Typer()


@app.callback()
def callback():
    """
    Awesome Portal Gun
    """


@app.command()
def shoot():
    """
    Shoot the portal gun
    """
    typer.echo("Shooting portal gun")


@app.command()
def load():
    """
    Load the portal gun
    """
    typer.echo("Loading portal gun")
```

TITLE: Creating a Basic Reign Management CLI with Typer in Python

```
@app.command()

    print(f"Destroying reign: {reign_name}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Defining CLI Parameters with Different Data Types in Typer
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to define CLI parameters with different data types in Typer. It includes a string argument, integer and float options with default values, and a boolean flag option that creates --female/--no-female flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/parameter-types/index.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def main(name: str, age: int = 20, height_meters: float = 1.89, female: bool = True):
    print(f"NAME is {name}, of type: {type(name)}")
    print(f"--age is {age}, of type: {type(age)}")
    print(f"--height-meters is {height_meters}, of type: {type(height_meters)}")
    print(f"--female is {female}, of type: {type(female)}")

```

TITLE: Creating Rich Tables for Structured Output
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create and display a table using Rich's Console and Table objects in a Typer application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/printing.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from rich.console import Console
from rich.table import Table

console = Console()


def main():
    table = Table(title="Items")
    table.add_column("Name", style="cyan")
    table.add_column("Item", style="magenta")
    table.add_row("Rick", "Portal Gun")
    table.add_row("Morty", "Plumbus")
    console.print(table)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

TITLE: Fixing Shell Completion with Context Object in Typer Callbacks
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the typer.Context object to detect when the callback is being executed during shell completion, allowing you to conditionally skip operations that would interfere with completion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/options/callback-and-context.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def name_callback(ctx: typer.Context, value: str):
    if ctx.resilient_parsing:
        return value
    print("Validating name")
    if value != "Camila":
        raise typer.BadParameter("Only Camila is allowed")
    return value


def main(name: str = typer.Option(..., callback=name_callback)):
    print(f"Hello {name}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

TITLE: Implementing an Item Management Module with Typer for a CLI Application
DESCRIPTION: A CLI module for item management with create, delete, and sell commands. This demonstrates how to create multiple commands within a single Typer app that can be integrated into a larger CLI structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/subcommands/nested-subcommands.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def create(item_name: str):
    """Create an item."""
    print(f"Creating item: {item_name}")


@app.command()
def delete(item_name: str):
    """Delete an item."""
    print(f"Deleting item: {item_name}")


@app.command()
def sell(item_name: str, price: float):
    """Sell an item."""
    print(f"Selling item: {item_name} for {price}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Implementing User Add Command
DESCRIPTION: Defines the user add command functionality in a separate module, creating a standalone Typer app instance for adding users.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/one-file-per-command.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()
```

TITLE: Basic Path Parameter in Typer CLI Application
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to declare a CLI parameter as a pathlib.Path object, allowing for proper handling of file paths in a Typer application. The example shows how to check if a configuration file exists and read its contents.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/parameter-types/path.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pathlib import Path

import typer


app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def main(config: Path = None):
    if config is None:
        typer.echo("No config file")
        raise typer.Abort()
    if not config.exists():
        typer.echo("The config doesn't exist")
        return
    if config.is_dir():
        typer.echo("Config is a directory, will use all its config files")
        return
    if config.is_file():
        text = config.read_text()
        typer.echo(f"Config file contents: {text}")
        return


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Terminating a Python CLI Program with typer.Exit()
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to terminate a CLI program using `typer.Exit()`. It shows a user creation scenario where the program exits early if a user already exists, preventing any subsequent code from running.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/terminating.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer


def maybe_create_user(username: str):
    # Simulate checking if user exists
    if username == "rick":
        print(f"The user already exists")
        # This will terminate the program
        raise typer.Exit()
    return username


def send_new_user_notification(username: str):
    print(f"Notification sent for new user: {username}")


def main(username: str):
    new_user = maybe_create_user(username)
    print(f"User created: {new_user}")
    send_new_user_notification(username)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to organize CLI commands into custom panels by using the 'rich_help_panel' parameter. Commands are grouped into three panels: default (Commands), 'Utils and Configs', and 'Help and Others'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/commands/help.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def create(username: str):
    """Create a new user. âœ¨"""
    typer.echo(f"Creating user: {username}")


@app.command()
def delete(username: str):
    """Delete a user. ðŸ”¥"""
    typer.echo(f"Deleting user: {username}")


@app.command(rich_help_panel="Utils and Configs")
def config(config_file: str):
    """Configure the system. ðŸ”§"""
    typer.echo(f"Configuring with: {config_file}")


@app.command(rich_help_panel="Utils and Configs")
def sync(username: str):
    """Synchronize the system or something fancy like that. â™»"""
    typer.echo(f"Syncing user: {username}")


@app.command(rich_help_panel="Help and Others")
def help(topic: str):
    """Get help with the system. â“"""
    typer.echo(f"Showing help for: {topic}")


@app.command(rich_help_panel="Help and Others")
def report(issue: str):
    """Report an issue. ðŸ›"""
    typer.echo(f"Reporting issue: {issue}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Accessing CallbackParam Object in Typer Callbacks

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def name_callback(param: typer.CallbackParam, ctx: typer.Context, value: str):
    if ctx.resilient_parsing:
        return value
    print(f"Validating param: {param.name}")
    if value != "Camila":
        raise typer.BadParameter("Only Camila is allowed")
    return value


def main(name: str = typer.Option(..., callback=name_callback)):
    print(f"Hello {name}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

TITLE: Smart Value Completion with Incomplete Value Checking
DESCRIPTION: Enhanced autocompletion that filters suggestions based on partially typed input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/options-autocompletion.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

def complete_name(incomplete: str) -> list[str]:
    names = ["Camila", "Carlos", "Sebastian"]
    completion = []
    for name in names:
        if name.startswith(incomplete):
            completion.append(name)
    return completion

app = typer.Typer()

@app.command()
def main(
    name: str = typer.Option(
        ...,
        help="The name to say hi to.",
        autocompletion=complete_name,
    )
):
    typer.echo(f"Hello {name}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Setting Progress Bar Length in Typer
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set an explicit length for a Typer progress bar when the iterable's length is not known in advance. Uses a generator function to simulate fetching data from an API.

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
import typer
import time

def iterate_user_ids():
    # Let's imagine this is a web API
    for i in range(100):
        time.sleep(0.01)
        yield i

def main():
    total = 100
    with typer.progressbar(iterate_user_ids(), length=total) as progress:
        for value in progress:
            # Process each user ID
            pass
    
    typer.echo(f"Processed {total} user IDs.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

TITLE: Locating File with Typer Launch
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use typer.launch() with locate=True to open the system file browser at a specific file location. Includes setup code for creating a config directory and file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/launch.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer
from pathlib import Path

def main():
    app_dir = Path(typer.get_app_dir("awesome-cli"))
    if not app_dir.exists():
        app_dir.mkdir(parents=True)
    
    config_file = app_dir / "config.txt"
    if not config_file.exists():
        config_file.write_text("""some settings here
        some more settings
        """)
    
    config_file_str = str(config_file)
    print("Opening config directory")
    typer.launch(config_file_str, locate=True)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

TITLE: Autocompletion with Help Text Support
DESCRIPTION: Implements autocompletion with help text for supported shells (Zsh, Fish, PowerShell).
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/options-autocompletion.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

names = [
    ("Camila", "The reader of books."),
    ("Carlos", "The writer of scripts."),
    ("Sebastian", "The type hints guy.")
]

def complete_name(incomplete: str) -> list[tuple[str, str]]:
    completion = []
    for name, help_text in names:
        if name.startswith(incomplete):
            completion.append((name, help_text))
    return completion

app = typer.Typer()

@app.command()
def main(
    name: str = typer.Option(
        ...,
        help="The name to say hi to.",
        autocompletion=complete_name,
    )
):
    typer.echo(f"Hello {name}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Implementing Exclusive Executable Callbacks in Typer
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a callback that only executes when no subcommand is specified by checking if ctx.invoked_subcommand is None. The callback initializes a database only when run directly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/commands/context.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def create(username: str):
    """Create a new user."""
    typer.echo(f"Creating user: {username}")


@app.command()
def delete(username: str):
    """Delete a user."""
    typer.echo(f"Deleting user: {username}")


@app.callback(invoke_without_command=True)
def callback(ctx: typer.Context):
    """Common stuff for the CLI app."""
    if ctx.invoked_subcommand is None:
        typer.echo("Initializing database")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Generator-based Autocompletion Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Simplified autocompletion using Python generators with yield statements instead of building lists.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/options-autocompletion.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

names = [
    ("Camila", "The reader of books."),
    ("Carlos", "The writer of scripts."),
    ("Sebastian", "The type hints guy.")
]

def complete_name(incomplete: str):
    for name, help_text in names:
        if name.startswith(incomplete):
            yield (name, help_text)

app = typer.Typer()

@app.command()
def main(
    name: str = typer.Option(
        ...,
        help="The name to say hi to.",
        autocompletion=complete_name,
    )
):
    typer.echo(f"Hello {name}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Context-Aware Multiple Value Completion
DESCRIPTION: Advanced autocompletion that uses Typer context to filter out already selected values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/options-autocompletion.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from typing import List
import typer

names_data = [
    ("Camila", "The reader of books."),
    ("Carlos", "The writer of scripts."),
    ("Sebastian", "The type hints guy.")
]

def complete_name(
    ctx: typer.Context,
    incomplete: str,
):
    names = ctx.params.get("names") or []
    for name, help_text in names_data:
        if name.startswith(incomplete) and name not in names:
            yield (name, help_text)

app = typer.Typer()

@app.command()
def main(
    names: List[str] = typer.Option(
        ...,
        help="The name to say hi to.",
        autocompletion=complete_name,
    )
):
    for name in names:
        typer.echo(f"Hello {name}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Version CLI Option with Required Parameters in Python with Typer

```
def name_callback(value: str):
    if value != "Camila":
        raise typer.BadParameter("Only Camila is allowed")
    return value


def version_callback(value: bool):
    if value:
        typer.echo(f"Awesome CLI Version: {__version__}")
        raise typer.Exit()


@app.command()
def main(
    name: str = typer.Option(
        ..., callback=name_callback, help="The name to say hi to"
    ),
    version: bool = typer.Option(
        False, "--version", callback=version_callback, is_flag=True, help="Show the version and exit"
    ),
):
    """Print a nice message"""
    typer.echo(f"Hello {name}")

```

DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use typer.confirm() to ask for user confirmation before performing an action in a Typer application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/prompt.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

def main():
    delete = typer.confirm("Are you sure you want to delete it?")
    if delete:
        print("Deleting it!")
    else:
        print("Not deleting")
        raise typer.Abort()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

TITLE: Breaking Shell Completion with Print Statements in Callback Functions
DESCRIPTION: Shows how adding print statements in callback functions can break shell completion. This example demonstrates the issue by adding a 'Validating name' message that interrupts the completion process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/options/callback-and-context.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def name_callback(value: str):
    print("Validating name")
    if value != "Camila":
        raise typer.BadParameter("Only Camila is allowed")
    return value


def main(name: str = typer.Option(..., callback=name_callback)):
    print(f"Hello {name}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

TITLE: Manual Progress Bar Updates in Typer
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to manually update a Typer progress bar when processing occurs in irregular intervals. This is useful for batch processing or when progress can't be determined by simple iteration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/progressbar.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
import typer
import time

def main():
    total = 1000
    with typer.progressbar(length=total, label="Batches") as progress:
        batch_size = 100
        for _ in range(0, total, batch_size):
            # Fake processing time
            time.sleep(0.1)
            # Update progress
            progress.update(batch_size)
    
    typer.echo(f"Processed {total} things in batches.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    typer.run(main)
```

```
origin  git@github.com:yourusername/typer.git (push)

origin  git@github.com:yourusername/typer.git (fetch)
```

TITLE: Sample Typer Application for Testing
DESCRIPTION: A simple Typer application with two commands (hello and goodbye) that can be used to test shell completion functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/contributing.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()


@app.command()
def hello():
    print("Hello")


@app.command()
def goodbye():
    print("Goodbye")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Team Members Template Loop in Markdown/Jinja
DESCRIPTION: A Jinja template loop that renders a list of team members with their GitHub avatars and usernames. The template iterates through a 'members' array and creates a user card with a link to each member's GitHub profile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/management.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{% for user in members["members"] %}

<div class="user"><a href="https://github.com/{{ user.login }}" target="_blank"><div class="avatar-wrapper"><img src="https://github.com/{{ user.login }}.png"/></div><div class="title">@{{ user.login }}</div></a></div>
{% endfor %}
```

TITLE: Command Order in Typer CLI Applications
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how the order of command definitions in the code affects the order they appear in the help text. Commands are displayed in the order they are defined.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/tutorial/commands/index.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()

@app.command()
def delete():
    print("Deleting user: Hiro Hamada")

@app.command()
def create():
    print("Creating user: Hiro Hamada")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app()
```

TITLE: Updating Command Group Naming in Typer (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the breaking change in Typer where auto-naming of command groups based on callback function names is removed. Users now need to explicitly set the command group name when using add_typer().
SOURCE: https://github.com/fastapi/typer.git/blob/master/docs/release-notes.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()
users_app = typer.Typer()

app.add_typer(users_app)


@users_app.callback()
def users():  # <-- This was the inferred command group name
    """
    Manage users in the app.
    """


@users_app.command()
def create(name: str):
    print(f"Creating user: {name}")
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import typer

app = typer.Typer()
users_app = typer.Typer()

app.add_typer(users_app, name="users")  # <-- Explicitly set the command group name


@users_app.callback()
def users():
    """
    Manage users in the app.
    """


@users_app.command()
def create(name: str):
    print(f"Creating user: {name}")
```
